result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jasper David Hartwig

defendant.name: Hartwig, Jasper David

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 8:58 AM Defendant Jasper David Hartwig in court.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Van Kerkvoorder appears for SPD office - not eligible. Discussion held. Recess 8:59am. Recalled 9:13am. Court reviews petition, appoints Attorney Karl Green at the rate of $75/wk comm 11-2-22. PH remains on calendar

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:42 AM Defendant Jasper David Hartwig in court.  Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions: Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division. Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
